website_summaries.verdict: If you’re willing to use your own wastebasket to save a few bucks, this durable, efficient, and compact paper shredder is certainly worth a look.
pros: Easily handles up to 8 sheets at a time
Side expands to fit most wastebaskets
Shreds credit cards, DVDs, and CDs
Able to shred 9.8 feet of paper per minute

customer_reviews.title: This little shredder packs a mean punch!!
customer_reviews.text: This little shredder right here is a god one! I had a lot of papers to shred I mean a lot. This shredder did the job!! Keep in mind that its a little shredder and don't try to over do it .when it gets hot, it will shut itself off. Don't be alarmed its normal. Other than that, its great. I didn't have to notify seller of anything, the shredder was perfectly packaged and shipped through FED-EX.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: This shredder works great compared to other shredders I have had in the ...
customer_reviews.text: This shredder works great compared to other shredders I have had in the past. I went looking for a shredder that would fit over my waste basket and was unable to find them in target or Walmart etc.. Most of the o Es I had in the past were inexpensive and cheaply made but they did what they were suppose to do. This one seems much sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: adjustable to fit larger waste containers. Nice Unit!!
customer_reviews.text: Unlike the others I found, one can fit this over a larger waste container. All the others with the fitted waste baskets are just too small. I would be emptying them 4 times a day. Not only does it fit larger size waste containers (adjustable width), but it does a great job of shredding documents fast.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Quick and efficient. I tried to burn her up and couldn't do it on my mountain. Does credit cards well. For the home this is perfect. I bought a can at big Lots for cheap and off we go.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Good quality shredder
customer_reviews.text: The Aurora shredder is doing a good job for me. I do not put the maximum sheets it recommends. Works better with 3-5 sheets. Some paper is thicker than others. I have used it a lot and it doesn't slow down! Fits well on a 54 quart Sterilite trash can.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well. I knew, when I bought it, that it would not fit the trash can for which it was bought, and was resigned to furnishing my own crosspiece. However, I was surprised to find that the fixed notch on the shredder body would not accommodate the lip of a standard "Rubbermaid product.
customer_reviews.author: Homohabilis

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, and guaranteed to break.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, but very cheaply made. The slide out arm that allows this to rest on top of a waste basket unceremoniously broke after less than two months. The plastic arms are really thin, and once broken, make it impossible to use this as it was intended, effectively turning it into a 5lb piece of garbage. Keep up the great work, Aurora
customer_reviews.author: Chachi in Charge

customer_reviews.title: Bad product
customer_reviews.text: Really bad, I used it few times and then did not work well
customer_reviews.author: Ahmad

customer_reviews.title: Not a good shredder for privacy!
customer_reviews.text: This product does not cross cut paper. I haven't needed to uses the cd or credit card shredding features yet, but on paper I had to feed the cut strips back through the shredder to try to destroy the information I needed to keep secure. I could read my social security number on the first shred. Not good! It didn't not adequately fit my trash can so I will have to purchase a can to accommodate it should I decide to keep it. On a positive the size is great. I need something I can store in a small closet.
customer_reviews.author: GiGi

customer_reviews.title: Slow but steady and versatile
customer_reviews.text: The size is so great! It can fit over many containers like garbage cans or boxes. It can easily handle 4 pages at a time, but runs slower and with more sound at 8 pages. After about 200 sheets a light came on that said it was overhot and needed to cool. After several hours the light switched off and we finished another 100 pages with no problem. It says it shreds credit cards and CD’s, but we haven’t tried that.
customer_reviews.author: LoHa

customer_reviews.title: Great workhorse shredder
customer_reviews.text: Great shredder, does the job. I wanted a shredder that didn't come with it's own basket, as we didn't really have a place for it. With this one's extendable arm, it attaches directly to my office waste bin and I can shred with no problem, and then collapse it and put it back into a drawer for storage. The CD destroyer and credit card shredding work great, in addition to its paper shredding functions (though you should be sure not to exceed it's 8-sheet recommendation, more than that and you can hear it struggling to chew through the paper). Very easy to use, would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S. Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Jams repeatedly
customer_reviews.text: I got this shredder to replace on older model that had worked for many years. This one is complete crap. It would barely accommodate six pages without jamming. After repeated problems until it would not work, spent hours cleaning it out. Worked for a few weeks, then began jamming again even if only one or two pages were fed at a time. Reached a point where I would have to unplug and clean after only a couple of pages. Don't waste your money on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Cornish

customer_reviews.title: Lemon?
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed. The first time, it worked fine, only a few sheets (much less than rec 6 sheets.) The second time I used it for about 10 sheets standard size, one or two sheets at a time, and it jammed up. Repeatedly. Third time it keeps running and running w/o any paper inserted.
customer_reviews.author: Abby McIlroy

customer_reviews.title: Badass little machine!
customer_reviews.text: I filled up over 6 garbage bags with shredded old documents from an old filing cabinet. 8 sheet max, unless shredding thicker than standard paper or the machine will overheat and need about 15 minutes to cool down. If you don’t stress it out too hard by adding too much paper at once, it’ll keep going for a while. Tore up credit cards very well. Highly recommended, especially when you don’t want to take up space buying a full shredder with basket included. Quiet for a shredder (not as loud as a blender), but it makes a little noise while shredding. Very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Carney

customer_reviews.title: Jammed on 3rd sheet of paper
customer_reviews.text: Jammed on 3rd sheet of paper. Clogs at edge and stops, would not feed until I ran it for a minute, then I had to fold the sheet 1/2 to get it to feed. I sent it back and bought another model. The shreds are long and thin and not good for bank documents. I love the idea, to just set it across the old shredder basket, but this one is such poor quality, it isn't practical at all for normal use.
customer_reviews.author: Mildred Bonazzoli

customer_reviews.title: Nice little strip-cut shredder!
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. These are light duty machines- for home office use mainly. Strip cut shredders are not that secure as the strips can be pieced back together, so if you're wanting a machine to help protect against identity theft, I would recommend getting a cross-cut or micro-cut shredder. We use these strip cut shredders to shred our old papers and the shredded paper is then donated to animal shelters and rescues for use in puppy crates- and the strips are perfect for that. This machine will overheat with heavy use and need a cooling off period, but that is common with heavy use. It's been a good little shredder.
customer_reviews.author: Michaden

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic paper shredder
customer_reviews.text: The instant I received the shredder, I took it out of the box and started running it through it paces. I mean about 20lbs worth of paper! Ran through it like a champ, not one hiccup. Very simple to use as well, one switch for everything - auto on, off and reverse. I like that there is no basket for convenient storage. I also dropped it from the table from about waist height, not a scratch or dent. The plastic housing is extremely stiff and durable. Highly recommended, fantastic product!
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: I think if it's not abused it's okay.
customer_reviews.text: I had a lot of paper to shred. This almost lasted 12 garbage bags full. I probably should have let it cool down occasionally. Or not put the maximum sheets in once in awhile. Keep it down to about four sheets Max and will probably last a long time. I just send you some. But I did buy another one of the same exact brand and model. Mostly because of the price. And it is simple to use. It's a paper shredder!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen S

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect  on a 12in to 14 inch wide trash can!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect on a 12 in to 14in wide trash can. I use a sterilite 13.2 gallon 50L trash can And it fits perfect side to side on the trash can. Works better than cross cut shredder because the cross cut pieces get stuck in the bottom of a cross cut shredder this one works perfect because it is straight cut shredder! Also remember to lube the shredder before 1st time use and unplug it after turning it off after each use.
customer_reviews.author: Graham

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase for At Home Use
customer_reviews.text: I respect my privacy and purchased this item because it will help me guard my privacy. Out of the box it works like a gem. I bought it based on price because I live on a low income, I didn't know what to expect. I'm pleasantly surprised after shredding 2 years of documents and receipts without this machine breaking down once. I use a fabric box, the organizer collapsible kind found everywhere these days, as the "basket" and it fits perfectly. If you are looking for a shredder for use at home, I encourage you to purchase this one and follow the directions for use if you want it to last for years.
customer_reviews.author: TenaciousT

customer_reviews.title: Super Duty with all the right features
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this to spread about 15 years worth of documents and i’ve Got to say, it’s quality, the amount of sheets it can tackle at once, it’s constant availableness and super importantly the main two features that really make it stand out are the reverse feature and, so excellent, the self regulating heat feature which turns it off if it’s getting overheated so you don’t kill it. 5 star buy for a 1 star price!
customer_reviews.author: rochelle foles

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the money  love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this shredder, the one I had prior to it had its own basket I had to keep emptying it was a cross cutter. This is a strip cutter my documents aren't so important that I have to destroy them so you can place it right on top of the pail and the strips go into the garbage immediately you don't have to spell them all over The floor to empty it. This is the only shredder I will ever buy again love it
customer_reviews.author: Judith

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.text: It says it will shred 8 papers. It does keep them in long strips so I had to rip regular notebook sized paper in half. Does over heat adter a while (I had years of paperwork to shred) but overall I'm pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Maddog

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: This is less of a paper shredder and more of a series of vertical scissors. It makes one continual shred vertically per strip which makes the final product very easy to reconstruct. This thing would be an identity thief's or stalker's best friend. It would literal be impossible to thwart identity theft with this shredder, unless you dispose of each strip individually.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SO compact and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: So far, this has been a great little item. Purchased for home use, I didn't want a big clunky machine to take up even more space when I wouldn't be using it on a consistent basis. I just wanted something to be available when needed. This fits the bill. I saw complaints that when placed on top of a lightweight plastic waste bin it tipped over. I have it sitting on a square, solid, cardboard box. Because my town recycles paper I just shred and then empty the cardboard box into the recycle container. Case closed. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: mimib

customer_reviews.title: Work's Well with 2-4 pages folded at a time
customer_reviews.text: I have two of this product in my office. One over my wastebasket and the other over a much larger basket for paper shredding. I've found that the machine works best when folding letter size paper in half prior to inserting it. I also make sure that the folder paper is centered and inserted with the paper in such a way that it is 5 and half inches across. While an 8 page thickness will go through, it does so slowly and appears to tax the machine. I find 4 page thickness to be the maximum this machine should take. To avoid overheating the machine, I don't do more than 10 insertions at a time. I also use lubricating sheets.
customer_reviews.author: D. Levy

customer_reviews.title: Used over recycle bin.
customer_reviews.text: Using a clamp on a large recycle bin. Can mount the Shredder to shred without emptying a small container all the time. Nice how it shreds entire envelopes contents at once. Shreds without over heating like a shredder I used before. Bought because it can be used on a large recycle bin with extra mounts rail.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: This fits on my round trash can
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a stand alone shredder to fit on my existing can. I had not seen any offered for a while since my old one died. Just the all in one shedders and cans. I wanted to keep my nice big 13" diameter trash can. So I have been drowning my papers in water for a while now. I just saw this offered here and ordered not being sure if it would fit a round can. It works great and very happy to have a good working shredder again.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Hendrickson

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This is a good shredder if you are using it for home. Since it can do only 8 paper portions it takes a while if you have to a big quantity. Blades seem to be fine from the first use, however I would have liked the unit to not get overheated as quickly as it does. All is all decent build quality and works well for now.
customer_reviews.author: Prithwiraj Ghosh Roy

customer_reviews.title: Aurora Strip Cut shredder
customer_reviews.text: August 25th just arrived, put right to work shredding CD's and stapled paperwork. CD's it just breaks them into 4 pieces my old unit would shred CD's into strips No issues shredding 8 pages stapled together. Knocked a star off because it shreds the paper into long strips instead of smaller cuts, just like the name stated Strip cut paper. Filled up a 13 gallon container quick but it was all fluff up paper shreds Recommend based on cost and ease of use Will update as needed
customer_reviews.author: Ocfive

customer_reviews.title: It’s a good little machine
customer_reviews.text: It does its job. I like that’s adjustable to fit your trash can or box. I shred my unwanted mail quickly along with other documents. States it can shred 8 at one time, I tried it and it likes 6 better. But that’s ok. I didn’t realize it had a cd shredder too! I bet that would be ok to shred Credit Cards too.
customer_reviews.author: MeliaK

customer_reviews.title: 6-Sheet Strip-Cut Paper/Credit Card Auto Start/Stop Shredder without Wastebasket
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat serves the purpose but the strips are too wide so you have to make sure you feed the paper in a way that will shred the information and make it non readable. The credit card shredding is a complete fail, it cuts the credit card in a way that the strips still show full name and card number, tried to feed it differently to make sure information didn't show... did not cut at all, ended up cutting it with scissors. Solution: went to Sam's and got a good one which shreds like confetti. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This ond good shredder.
customer_reviews.text: This one of the best home shredders I have used. I have shredded papers, credit cards and cds with no problems. I forced a jam in the unit to test the function and when I pushed the jam remover button it was almost freaky how quickly the jam was cleared. I am very happy was this unit and would recommend this to anyone who needs a very good home paper shredder.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph E. Owens

customer_reviews.title: NO PROLEMS, EXCELLENT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I choose this because I wanted to be able to shred into something other then the small baskets the other shredders had to offer. This is a great product, I shredded a 20 gallon garbage bag full of paper, and it only stopped once to cool off. The price was right and the product is great. I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Iris

customer_reviews.title: Great little shredder!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small and inexpensive shredder to use for old papers I found while cleaning out my closet. This does the trick! It fit great on the top of my rectangular trash can. It shredded all my papers, and didn’t burn out or overheat. It’s going to be useful to have a shredder of my own at home, instead of having to rip or cut up important papers!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Cavender

customer_reviews.title: Credit Card Cutter should be redesigned
customer_reviews.text: It is quieter than the one I replaced. I am disappointed the credit card cutting. It is instructed to cut long ways vs horizontal. By cutting the way as instructed it leaves strips that still have valuable information all together. If it were designed to cut horizontal, each line of information would be cut apart. Putting card in horizontal strained the motor. I was able to turn the card on a diagonal without too much motor strain and cut information better than vertical.
customer_reviews.author: Woodchuck

customer_reviews.title: Returned it.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return this. It doesn't seem powerful enough to take care of my massive amounts n of papers and I think a criss cross cut would be better. The piece that pulls out to make it fit on a garbage is very flimsy and I think it would easily break off.
customer_reviews.author: Moodieschick

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small, portable shredder and that's exactly what this is. It is not heavy duty, so don't put a lot of papers in at any one time and don't expect it to shred papers for hours and hours. 10 minutes tops is what this can handle in terms of steady shredding. And then it shuts off, and you must wait 10 minutes or so for it to cool down and re-set. So, if you have a busy office generating a lot of paper, look elsewhere. But if you're at home and have small piles of financial papers, bills, personal information that you need to take care of, then this is the right fit.
customer_reviews.author: M D

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints about this product. It does what it says and definitely shreds credit cards with ease. It overheats a little but back for more after a 15 minute rest. What's even better is that it's small enough to fit on top of my two tier file cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: Lorine

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: This has worked out well for me. I don’t keep it out because I only use every 2-3 weeks or so when I’ve got a good pile to shred. It extends and fits across my trash can okay, but sometimes from the vibrations of shredding it falls in. Maybe if my trash can was a bit narrower it’d sit better. Wish it extended out a little more. Otherwise pretty sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: SJM

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I actually wanted a crosscut shredder, but after I received it and realized it wasn't, I checked the description and it clearly states the kind of shredder it its. So NO deception. It works well for me (light use) and I will keep using it.
customer_reviews.author: Illinois Buyer

customer_reviews.title: I was pleasantly pleased. It's fast
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know what to expect as I have never had a shredder before. I was pleasantly pleased. It's fast, does a very nice job shredding. I only put in three papers at a time. The machine slowed a little but still did a good job. When I'm done I put it back in the box and on a shelf and it's ready for the next use. Now I don't do a lot of shredding so I can't say how good it would be under pressure however I do believe it would hold it's own.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I love this shredder! You can tell that it is a better grade of shredder. I've had some shredders that will say they handle 6 sheets, but really only handle 3. It can handle, with no effort, the number of sheet it says. Plus it has the credit card and CD shred feature, which is a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Shredder
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how well it worked and how fast it was. I started out with only two sheets because wasn't sure it would work with more, then was able to put in as many as 6 with out it getting stuck. Have not tried more than 6 at a time. It never over heated and I had it running for over half an hour at one point. It also worked on a credit card!
customer_reviews.author: Janer

customer_reviews.title: Portable Beast!!
customer_reviews.text: Great portable shredder. Couldn’t be happier. It is a beast at shredding documents.
customer_reviews.author: Todd A. Rosenthal

customer_reviews.title: The little shredder that could
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting to organize my filing cabinet, so I bought this shredder to recycle the paper without exposing my personal information. I was shocked! It worked amazingly! I expected it to shut off after 20 minutes, but I used it up to 3 hours at a time just fine. Filled 4 huge bags of shredded paper! Definitely recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa O.

customer_reviews.title: Great shredder!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is one awesome shredder. We replaced our traditional large shredder with this because our old one burned out and we are now going on the road fill time so needed one that would take up less room. This shredder is like Mr Mighty. It shreds everything!!! Paper, credit cards and CD's. No slowing down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: This shredder is used for pre burning in our incinerator, multiple bills etc burn like a book you have to flake them apart to burn throughly. This shredder does a very good job. I fed a lot of bills through it and had no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Quiet & Quality shredding
customer_reviews.text: I love this shredder. It is quiet, handles several sheets of paper at once and it even shreds plastic credit cards and CD's. Although I have not used it to shred a CD yet. It is made of durable plastic and high quality materials.
customer_reviews.author: L8bloomer

customer_reviews.title: Great little shredder
customer_reviews.text: Great little shredder. It can overheat if you use it too long (which I did, oops! But I used it pretty steadily for a couple hours). After it cools down, it works perfectly again. I especially love that it's portable. It does not have the cross-cut, so if shredding extremely sensitive documents, you might want to be wary, but for the day-to-day shredding of junk mail, old receipts, etc. it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Meryl

customer_reviews.title: Don't Bother.
customer_reviews.text: Used once to shred single pages (it couldn't handle two at a time), it worked. When used a second time, it jammed on a single page, reverse would not clear it, it is totally broken. Piece of crap, which is why it is $20! Don't bother. Plus I couldn't get a refund from DesertSkyLLC because I was over the 90 day limit, even though they sold me a worthless item. Look elsewhere. PS - Made In China.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: great product!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product that is well worth the price. I have used it to shred several plastic cards and stacks of paper. I've yet to experience any jams or dulling of the blades. My favorite aspect is that it takes up hardly any space and can fit onto most generally sized bins. Not to mention, it is very light so it isn't a burden to move it around if need be.
customer_reviews.author: Kev.dot.Carter

customer_reviews.title: little but mighty
customer_reviews.text: Really like compact size ,doesn't take up room to store it , can fit it over a 13 gallon trash can so I'm not emptying it after 3 or 4 pieces of paper. Credit card shredder in center works great just shredded them right up like a piece of paper. Nice safety feature is it will shut off when it gets hot ,which takes a while, so you don't burn up the machine. Love my shredder and price was good , thank you
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Garner

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for clearing old papers and works amazing on credit cards... I have to admit I was worried about shredding the cards, but it went smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really Good
customer_reviews.text: I always buy this style so I can still use the garbage can. Other shredders are just shredders. This is the best one I have ever had, especially for the price. It is the only one I have found that has the adjustable arm to fit any can AND has a credit card shredder.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This item was a replacement for one that I had for years, and use day to day for small item destruction. It fits over the top of my trashcan and allows room to place items into the receptacle without having to remove it. The price and quality are a match. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis J. Reese

customer_reviews.title: You can tell the excellent construction of the mechanism by the smooth sound
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a much older and less expensive unit that died during a massive shredding project. Even considering that, this unit still out performs anything I have used previously. You can tell the excellent construction of the mechanism by the smooth sound. Does a great job without getting "tired", and is very versatile. Totally pleased!
customer_reviews.author: John Hoffmeyer

customer_reviews.title: good for light shred jobs
customer_reviews.text: I had a 2 1/2 inch stack of shredding. My first experience with shredder was that the motor overheated and stopped working for about 15min then came back to life shortly after. The product is sturdy and motor seems reliable with light use. Just know that it will take time to shred big stacks. I’m keeping it for now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a good house shredder
customer_reviews.text: Solid option all around. Not quite a beast, but at this price point it's about what you'd expect. It gets jammed with old bits of paper frequently, and if your paper is at all crumbly, be ready to unplug and pull the whole thing out to re-insert. This is a good house shredder, but I wouldn't count on it in a home office or for any heavy-duty work. Overall, it does the job, and I am pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay on very well
customer_reviews.text: Falls off the garbage can very easily. Hard to keep it from hitting the floor. It just might be operator air on my part. Maybe I need a different size garbage can. But it seems like the garbage can I have should work fine. But it works fine
customer_reviews.author: private

customer_reviews.title: Good at first but then...
customer_reviews.text: This shedder was getting the job done when I first got it. I made sure that I was not putting too many pages in it to avoid it jamming. The guide that came with it said no more than 8 sheets. By 6 months, the shedder stopped working. It stopped mid-shred and I couldn't reverse it to relieve the jam. I was positive that I didn't exceed the limit of papers. I would really love to get a replacement, but after reading the company's support page, I'd be better off buying a new one than shipping it to them for a replacement...
customer_reviews.author: natattack32

customer_reviews.title: Great for low-volume, home office shredding
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my home office to shred bills, credit cards, etc. It works great! You don't want to run too many papers through at once or allow it to overheat, but for occasional home use (as in, a couple times a week or less), this works well and is a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Trisine

customer_reviews.title: Sharp Shredder Top
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good shredder top I bought to replace my dead one. Because I long strip shredder is hard to find I went ahead and bought 2, and glad I did.? It is very sharp and I am grateful to have them
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Rose Evans

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Great deal I bought this after I purchased a shredder from Staples that came with the lockout key unfortunately I have a young toddler and lost the lockout key and was not able to use the shredder without it and Staples was giving me a hard time to get one needless to say I had to end up throwing it out and I purchase this one which is very convenient and portable and takes up wayless face I definitely recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice purchase. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I’m impressed at how well this works for the cost. It sits right in top of my can, shreds up a bunch of bills, and pops off and goes into the cupboard for storage. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: RMMazz

customer_reviews.title: Great little unit!
customer_reviews.text: Works well - automatic shuts off when no paper is present. Able to shred a credit card with no problems. Love that I can easily take it off my garbage can and don't have the mess of those bucket type shredders!
customer_reviews.author: Linda D

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderfully well.
customer_reviews.text: I brought this brand at a staple store. The outlet socket in my room blew out and it destroyed the paper shredder. I trust and really liked this shredder as it is very reliable, and works sooooo well. So I searched and brought the same shredder. I recommend this shredder. It works extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: Papillion7

customer_reviews.title: Not for the security minded shreddee
customer_reviews.text: It works and it's cheap, but it's not for anyone who's interested in security. It's a strip shredder and the strips are wide. I looked down and saw my social printed in big block numbers and perfectly centered on one of the strips, like it belonged there. The feed slot is exactly 8 1/2 inches wide, so most sheets struggle to fit. Make sure you shred across the text, not with the text, even though the paper may not fit in the tight slot. I learned my lesson, when this one croaks I'm going to spend more and get a better shredder.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Uses a basket or box for shredded paper. Love that, not an ugly plastic bin. Works good and is pretty quiet.
customer_reviews.author: daisy2do

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you use it with a deep wastepaper basket, otherwise it clogs but otherwise does a good job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly over the waste from a previously jammed shredder- why pay for a garbage can you don’t need- works perfectly for home, shredding HIPPA protected records no longer needed
customer_reviews.author: Susan Kaye

customer_reviews.title: Great *little* shredder for occasional needs
customer_reviews.text: Great little shredder that does the job! Great for the occasional shred. But adhere to the 6 page limit and make sure pages load straight. I jammed it on the second use when several pages went in wonky and didn't make it through. There is an "auto" and a "reverse" setting but not "on" setting, so it took minor surgery to fix the jam.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia

customer_reviews.title: Works Well, Use Any Size Bin!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best value paper shredder. I have another shredder I bought at an office supply store for nearly three times the price. It has a built in bin that fills up after just a few documents. Very disappointing. This one you can put on any size bin (I use a standard blue plastic recycling bin) and it holds more than double the other shredder! The shredder works very well!
customer_reviews.author: Terri262

customer_reviews.title: Good little work horse
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. It really gets a workout in my home office. No issues this far.
customer_reviews.author: BWL

customer_reviews.title: Great little shredder
customer_reviews.text: Great little shredder. Definitely stick to the 6 paper maximum, I've jammed it once already. It's sturdy and fits our trash can well. It shreds quickly and with little issue, all of those junk pre-approved credit cards went through. Great packaging, no dings or dents. I would definitely recommend this to someone like me who doesn't want/have room for a traditional shredder.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: A Nice Personal Shredder
customer_reviews.text: We bought this unit to replace an aging shredder. The ones in our local big box stores all came with their own containers and were not adjustable. We are using a heavy duty cardboard box that holds a ton (a lot) of shredded paper, so we needed an adjustable unit. We've had it a couple of weeks and, so far, it does everything advertised, including shredding multiple sheets, cardboard and plastic. Well worth the price IF it holds up until continuing use.
customer_reviews.author: JEB

customer_reviews.title: Because I live in a small space thought this would be better. I would recommend you get the one with ...
customer_reviews.text: It works okay. Because I live in a small space thought this would be better. I would recommend you get the one with the container. Also, it shreds in strips and they seem large. Opt for the confetii.
customer_reviews.author: B.J.

customer_reviews.title: Good but
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit, very pleased. Also purchased lubricating oil to extend life. Works well and quickly. Be careful that you treat extendable arms gently, had one break, Amazon came thru for me and replaced unit.
customer_reviews.author: Jan/Cleve, OH

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY Light Duty . . .
customer_reviews.text: This shredder will run for only a few minutes (less than 6 sheets at a time) before it shuts off . . . then it take almost 1/2 hour before it resets itself. This is the worst shredder I have ever operated. It will be going back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Paul J. Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Adaptable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the Aurora AS550S Paper Shredder that finally died on me after 14 years of use. I was hoping this new AU800SD model would fit on the existing metal mesh basket the previous model came with, but was in fact too wide. Nevertheless, it was adaptable enough to work with other bins.
customer_reviews.author: Zachariah Z Appleton

customer_reviews.title: Shreds fine, extension needs to be longer.
customer_reviews.text: Shredder works fine. The extension arm need the ability to extend further. Had to devise a piece of wood for it to fit my trash can. Needs ability to put bag on to catch and recycle shred.
customer_reviews.author: kenwood9065

customer_reviews.title: Does the job without taking room
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a shredder, but didn't want a big, clunky wastebasket to take up space and this was the answer. I can hide it in a drawer when not in use, place it on my existing wastebasket and it does the job just fine. It's not for heavy duty shredding, which is fine for my infrequent needs... so I'd recommend it. It works!
customer_reviews.author: Harold Marin

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best office product purchases I have made. I can just set the shredder over the garbage can and away I go. No more trying to empty a bin and getting paper dust or shreds of paper everywhere. It is clean and tidy. Takes up little room for storage when not using. Would highly recommend to purchase this paper shredder
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last long
customer_reviews.text: This product does the job, however it won’t last long. After following instructions, and only putting a couple of sheets through at a time, it died on me. I had it for a couple of months, and shredded maybe... 100-150 pieces of paper. It did the job well, but like I said it didn’t last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Strohmenger

customer_reviews.title: works great! compact enough for us to store in our ...
customer_reviews.text: works great! compact enough for us to store in our desk drawer - do yourself a favor though and make sure you only do 2 or 3 sheets at a time. it's worth the patience not to run out the life of the product. I used this to shred 5 years of tax returns that were outdated - worked great but I would do one year, then take a 20 min break to let it cool down.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney S.

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: Fits nicely over the 13 in wastebasket accompanying my former paper shredder. Works quietly and happily. I will invest in a bottle of shredder oil to extend the life of this shredder. I recommend this shredder if you have household shredding.
customer_reviews.author: Cr8tive1

customer_reviews.title: Very light duty.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent customer service. The product not so good. It jams very easily. There is no access panel to clear the jam. Only option is to stick a knife in there and run it along the blades. Unplugged of course. Not safe and not good for the blades.also won't shred more than 3 pieces ate a time. So all junk mail has to be opened and shredded price by piece.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC BUY
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE the Aurora Shredder!!! I had another one that got jammed so I bought this one. SO GLAD I DID!!! I does a great job of shredding everything I put through it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It can adjust to fit  trash cans that are wider than it is.
customer_reviews.text: It's quieter than my former one. You can put more sheets of paper in it than my former one. I haven't tried putting a CD in it yet, but for paper it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Emma Love

customer_reviews.title: Broken after very limited use
customer_reviews.text: We had it for nearly 6 months and used it maybe once or twice a week to shred some letters. It says not more than a 6 pages at a time but it got stuck a few times with less than 6. After 6 months it broke without a warning, only the reverse function is working. Knew it was a cheap product when I bought it but all the good reviews were misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Matthias Fink

customer_reviews.title: I have not decided if I am going to reorder one like this again or not
customer_reviews.text: Had this for 2 years and I shred about average 2 page a day, so not much. This product says it can handle 8 pages, but I have never put that many through it. I started having trouble with the paper going through and had to start pulling the shredded paper out from the bottom, then I looked and the shredder housing had broken on each side of the slit that the paper goes through on the bottom and that was somehow keeping the paper from going through, so going to have to trash this one. I have not decided if I am going to reorder one like this again or not. Really liked the way it worked at first.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good shredder
customer_reviews.text: if you need a replacement shredder or just a shredder in general this works perfectly. if you dont have a waste basket a standard milk crate works
customer_reviews.author: Katie L.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It cuts super fast and efficiently and I love that it saves Space without the basket You just stick it over the trash can and go!
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Not the best but it's something.
customer_reviews.text: It does what it needs to. As long as you put what is needed properly in. There is only on a small specific spot to shread cards which to me made no sense to do. I was shreading a credit card I got in the mail and it jammed on me twice when I put it correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Nice but it died
customer_reviews.text: It was nice, and i liked the ability to fit multiple receptacles but it died after my first use probably because i had built up so much paper. I put it through 2-3 sheets at a time but I think because it ran so long the shredder just gave out. Considering the price I can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: great for households
customer_reviews.text: we do not do a lot of shredding and it was hard to find just the top of a shredder without the basket and we like this shredder because we just put it over our recycling bin! We mostly bought it for junk mail with our names and address on it but it works great and even shreds old credit cards!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Works fast!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shredder to fit over my office trash basket. Sure makes easy work of throwing away the shredded papers. No mess! This is not a cross cut shredder like my old one, instead it cuts into long thin pieces. I don't have a problem with the difference. It seems to be much faster too. I'm very pleased with it, glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: ... asked her about it and she was so very nice I do appreciate
customer_reviews.text: It cuts the strips to ride for personal mail you can still see your name and your address on it so I'm sorry to say I had to send it back but I do think the lady at the company I called her and asked her about it and she was so very nice I do appreciate her
customer_reviews.author: Eve

customer_reviews.title: Works great, good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Shredder works exactly as advertised. Handles heavy paper, credit cards, staples, etc. without any problem. Adjusts easily to different waste paper can sizes and is quieter than my prior one. I hope I get the same life out of it as my earlier one.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Terrible shredder! This claims to shred up to 6 sheets of paper at one time. Attempted to shred 2 standard sheets of paper and the shredder struggled with it. I had a coupe of lingering peices of paper and attempted to shred 1 expired debit card and it got stuck. I had to get scissors to fix the jam. Once it was fixed I placed 3 standard sheets of paper and again the shredder failed.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal guardiola

product_meta.title: Aurora AU800SD Professional Strip Cut Paper Shredder/CD/Credit Card Shredder Without Wastebasket, 8-Sheet Strip-Cut No Basket
product_meta.description: Color:BlackDesigned to provide economical document security, this paper shredder is the perfect home device to help keep you safe from identity theft. The AU800SD accepts up to eight sheets of paper at a time and shreds them into 1/4-inch strips. Paper is shredded at a speedy 9.8 feet per minute. In addition to paper, the AU800SD shreds CDs and credit cards, keeping vital information from falling into the wrong hands. The throat of the shredder is 8.7 inches wide and the extendable arm fits over most wastebaskets. PRODUCT DETAILS: Sheet Capacity: 8 Cut Type: Strip cut Shred Size: 1/4" wide strips Security Level: Level P-1 (general internal documents) Shreds: Credit cards; Small staples Continuous Run Time: 2 minutes Shred Speed: 9.84 feet per minute Recommended Shredder Use: household or home office Throat Width: 8.7" Automatic Start/Stop: Yes Reverse Type: Manual Shreds Credit Cards: Yes Shreds CD/DVDs: Yes Overheat Protection: Yes Unit Size Dimensions: 13.00" W x 6.50" L x 2.95" H Warranty: 1-year machine; 1-year cutters
feature_bullets: Shreds credit cards and CDs / DVDs
Auto start/ stop. Thermal protection / Overheat protection
Jam-Remover (forward) and Manual reverse for cleaning paper jams
Extendable arm to fit over most waste baskets (Max length is 15" or 38.1 cm)
Shred Paper Capacity: 8 sheets of 20 lb. bond paper

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,005 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
